conversation.content: True or False? If every proper subsequence of ($x_n$) converges, then ($x_n$) converges as well.
False. A sequence can have all proper subsequences converge to the same limit without the sequence itself converging, for example, a sequence that oscillates but whose subsequences stabilize.
